page.title: 18COMMUNITY GROUPS - BARGOED
page.content: COMMUNITY GROUPS IN THE BARGOED AREA. The folk of the mining communities of South Wales have a tradition of active involvement in community life. This is due, to a large extent, to the hardships which these communities suffered during the depression years of this century. The town of Bargoed has long been regarded as a focal point for the upper Rhymney Valley in terms of transport, shopping, business and, until recently , employment. This has inevitably led to Bargoed being also an important centre of community /social life. In the town there are Brownies, Guides, Cubs, Scouts, Boys/ Girls Brigades, Army Cadets, Weight Watchers, Play Groups, Red Cross, Salvation Army, Camera, Model Railway and Youth Clubs, Charity Groups, O.A.P.s and, typical of the area Male Voice Choir and political parties.
